newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain unions confirm plans for metals strikes.
newsitem.headline: Spain unions confirm plans for metals strikes.

text.p: Spain's Workers Commission Union (CCOO) and General Workers Union (UGT) confirmed on Wednesday that metals workers would strike on July 17 and July 24, despite what they called a positive late Tuesday meeting with Industry Minister Josep Pique.
The unions are protesting against the possible sale of state-owned companies in the sector, and held a one-day strike on July 3.
"Yesterday's meeting was really positive. There has been a change in the (government's) position," a UGT spokesman said.
But the unions remained unconvinced about the government's intentions.
He said the government had promised to show unions industrial plans by the bidders for aluminium producer Inespal and steel maker CSI and to take trade union views into account.
"That was not that much. So we will go ahead with strikes," a spokesman for CCOO said.
Spanish State holding company SEPI is in talks with the U.S. Aluminum Company of America (Alcoa) over the sale of Inespal.
State holding company Agencia Industrial del Estado is in talks over the sale of control of CSI (Corporacion Siderurgica Integral).
